an8.86:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena icchānaṅgalaṃ nāma kosalānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
an8.86:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a village of the Kosalan brahmins named Icchānaṅgala.

an8.86:1.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
an8.86:1.2.eng: He stayed in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.

an8.86:1.3.eng: The brahmins and householders of Icchānaṅgala heard:

an8.86:1.4.pli: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito icchānaṅgalaṃ anuppatto icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
an8.86:1.4.eng: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Icchānaṅgala. He is staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.

an8.86:1.5.pli: Taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:

an8.86:1.6.eng: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those fit for training, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’ …

an8.86:1.7.pli: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṃ arahataṃ dassanaṃ hotī’”ti.
an8.86:1.7.eng: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

an8.86:2.1.pli: Atha kho icchānaṅgalakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tassā rattiyā accayena pahutaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya yena icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhaṃsu uccāsaddā mahāsaddā.
an8.86:2.1.eng: Then, when the night had passed, they took abundant fresh and cooked foods and went to the forest near Icchānaṅgala, where they stood outside the gates making a colossal racket.

an8.86:2.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgito bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti.
an8.86:2.2.eng: Now, at that time Venerable Nāgita was the Buddha’s attendant.

an8.86:2.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ nāgitaṃ āmantesi:
an8.86:2.3.eng: Then the Buddha said to Nāgita,

an8.86:2.4.pli: “ke pana te, nāgita, uccāsaddā mahāsaddā kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope”ti?
an8.86:2.4.eng: “Nāgita, who’s making that colossal racket? You’d think it was fishermen hauling in a catch!”

an8.86:2.5.pli: “Ete, bhante, icchānaṅgalakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā pahutaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitā bhagavantaṃyeva uddissa bhikkhusaṅghañcā”ti.
an8.86:2.5.eng: “Sir, it’s these brahmins and householders of Icchānaṅgala. They’ve brought abundant fresh and cooked foods, and they’re standing outside the gates wanting to offer it specially to the Buddha and the mendicant Saṅgha.”

an8.86:2.6.pli: “Māhaṃ, nāgita, yasena samāgamaṃ, mā ca mayā yaso.
an8.86:2.6.eng: “Nāgita, may I never become famous. May fame not come to me.

an8.86:2.7.pli: Yo kho, nāgita, nayimassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī. Yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
an8.86:2.7.eng: There are those who can’t get the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

an8.86:2.8.pli: so taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyyā”ti.
an8.86:2.8.eng: Let them enjoy the filthy, lazy pleasure of possessions, honor, and popularity.”

an8.86:3.1.eng: “Sir, may the Blessed One please relent now! May the Holy One relent!

an8.86:3.2.eng: Now is the time for the Buddha to relent.

an8.86:3.3.pli: Yena yeneva dāni, bhante, bhagavā gamissati tanninnāva bhavissanti brāhmaṇagahapatikā negamā ceva jānapadā ca.
an8.86:3.3.eng: Wherever the Buddha now goes, the brahmins and householders, and people of town and country will incline the same way.

an8.86:3.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, thullaphusitake deve vassante yathāninnaṃ udakāni pavattanti;
an8.86:3.4.eng: It’s like when the heavens rain heavily and the water flows downhill.

an8.86:3.5.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhante, yena yeneva dāni bhagavā gamissati tanninnāva bhavissanti brāhmaṇagahapatikā negamā ceva jānapadā ca.
an8.86:3.5.eng: In the same way, wherever the Buddha now goes, the brahmins and householders, and people of town and country will incline the same way.

an8.86:3.7.eng: Because of the Buddha’s ethics and wisdom.”

an8.86:4.1.pli: “Māhaṃ, nāgita, yasena samāgamaṃ, mā ca mayā yaso.
an8.86:4.1.eng: “Nāgita, may I never become famous. May fame not come to me.

an8.86:4.2.pli: Yo kho, nāgita, nayimassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī. Yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
an8.86:4.2.eng: There are those who can’t get the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

an8.86:4.3.pli: so taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyya.
an8.86:4.3.eng: Let them enjoy the filthy, lazy pleasure of possessions, honor, and popularity.

an8.86:5.1.pli: devatāpi kho, nāgita, ekaccā nayimassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhiniyo assu akicchalābhiniyo akasiralābhiniyo, yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an8.86:5.1.eng: Even some of the deities can’t get the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

an8.86:5.2.pli: Tumhākampi kho, nāgita, saṅgamma samāgamma saṅgaṇikavihāraṃ anuyuttānaṃ viharataṃ evaṃ hoti:
an8.86:5.2.eng: When you all come together to enjoy each other’s company, I think:

an8.86:5.3.pli: ‘na hi nūname āyasmanto imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhino assu akicchalābhino akasiralābhino. Yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an8.86:5.3.eng: ‘These venerables mustn’t get the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

an8.86:5.4.pli: Tathā hi paname āyasmanto saṅgamma samāgamma saṅgaṇikavihāraṃ anuyuttā viharanti’.
an8.86:5.4.eng: That must be because they come together to enjoy each other’s company.’

an8.86:6.1.pli: Idhāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhū passāmi aññamaññaṃ aṅgulipatodakena sañjagghante saṅkīḷante.
an8.86:6.1.eng: Take mendicants I see poking each other with their fingers, giggling and playing together.

an8.86:6.3.pli: ‘na hi nūname āyasmanto imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhino assu akicchalābhino akasiralābhino. Yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an8.86:6.3.eng: ‘These venerables mustn’t get the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

an8.86:6.4.pli: Tathā hi paname āyasmanto aññamaññaṃ aṅgulipatodakena sañjagghanti saṅkīḷanti’.
an8.86:6.4.eng: That must be because they’re poking each other with their fingers, giggling and playing together.’

an8.86:7.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhū passāmi yāvadatthaṃ udarāvadehakaṃ bhuñjitvā seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyutte viharante.
an8.86:7.1.eng: Take mendicants I see eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying down, and drowsing.

an8.86:7.3.pli: ‘na hi nūname āyasmanto imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhino assu akicchalābhino akasiralābhino. Yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an8.86:7.3.eng: ‘These venerables mustn’t get the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

an8.86:7.4.pli: Tathā hi paname āyasmanto yāvadatthaṃ udarāvadehakaṃ bhuñjitvā seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anuyuttā viharanti’.
an8.86:7.4.eng: That must be because they eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying down, and drowsing.’

an8.86:8.1.pli: Idhāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhuṃ passāmi gāmantavihāriṃ samāhitaṃ nisinnaṃ.
an8.86:8.1.eng: Take a mendicant living within a village who I see sitting immersed in samādhi.

an8.86:8.3.pli: ‘idāni imaṃ āyasmantaṃ ārāmiko vā upaṭṭhahissati samaṇuddeso vā. Taṃ tamhā samādhimhā cāvessatī’ti.
an8.86:8.3.eng: ‘Now a monastery worker, a novice, or a fellow practitioner will make this venerable fall from immersion.’

an8.86:8.4.pli: Tenāhaṃ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno na attamano homi gāmantavihārena.
an8.86:8.4.eng: So I’m not pleased that that mendicant is living within a village.

an8.86:9.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhuṃ passāmi āraññikaṃ araññe pacalāyamānaṃ nisinnaṃ.
an8.86:9.1.eng: Take a mendicant in the wilderness who I see sitting nodding in meditation.

an8.86:9.3.pli: ‘idāni ayamāyasmā imaṃ niddākilamathaṃ paṭivinodetvā araññasaññaṃyeva manasi karissati ekattan’ti.
an8.86:9.3.eng: ‘Now this venerable, having dispelled that sleepiness and weariness, will focus just on the unified perception of wilderness.’

an8.86:9.4.pli: Tenāhaṃ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
an8.86:9.4.eng: So I’m pleased that that mendicant is living in the wilderness.

an8.86:10.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhuṃ passāmi āraññikaṃ araññe asamāhitaṃ nisinnaṃ.
an8.86:10.1.eng: Take a mendicant in the wilderness who I see sitting without being immersed in samādhi.

an8.86:10.3.pli: ‘idāni ayamāyasmā asamāhitaṃ vā cittaṃ samādahissati, samāhitaṃ vā cittaṃ anurakkhissatī’ti.
an8.86:10.3.eng: ‘Now if this venerable’s mind is not immersed in samādhi they will immerse it; or if it is immersed in samādhi, they will preserve it.’

an8.86:10.4.pli: Tenāhaṃ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
an8.86:10.4.eng: So I’m pleased that that mendicant is living in the wilderness.

an8.86:11.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhuṃ passāmi āraññikaṃ araññe samāhitaṃ nisinnaṃ.
an8.86:11.1.eng: Take a mendicant in the wilderness who I see sitting immersed in samādhi.

an8.86:11.3.pli: ‘idāni ayamāyasmā avimuttaṃ vā cittaṃ vimuccissati, vimuttaṃ vā cittaṃ anurakkhissatī’ti.
an8.86:11.3.eng: ‘Now this venerable will free the unfreed mind or preserve the freed mind.’

an8.86:11.4.pli: Tenāhaṃ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
an8.86:11.4.eng: So I’m pleased that that mendicant is living in the wilderness.

an8.86:12.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhuṃ passāmi gāmantavihāriṃ lābhiṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
an8.86:12.1.eng: Take a mendicant who I see living within a village receiving robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an8.86:12.2.pli: So taṃ lābhasakkārasilokaṃ nikāmayamāno riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, riñcati araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni;
an8.86:12.2.eng: Enjoying possessions, honor, and popularity they neglect retreat, and they neglect remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.

an8.86:12.3.eng: They come down to villages, towns and capital cities and make their homes there.

an8.86:12.4.pli: Tenāhaṃ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno na attamano homi gāmantavihārena.
an8.86:12.4.eng: So I’m not pleased that that mendicant is living within a village.

an8.86:13.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, nāgita, bhikkhuṃ passāmi āraññikaṃ lābhiṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
an8.86:13.1.eng: Take a mendicant who I see in the wilderness receiving robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an8.86:13.2.pli: So taṃ lābhasakkārasilokaṃ paṭipaṇāmetvā na riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, na riñcati araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni.
an8.86:13.2.eng: Fending off possessions, honor, and popularity they don’t neglect retreat, and they don’t neglect remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.

an8.86:13.3.pli: Tenāhaṃ, nāgita, tassa bhikkhuno attamano homi araññavihārena.
an8.86:13.3.eng: So I’m pleased that that mendicant is living in the wilderness.

an8.86:14.1.pli: Yasmāhaṃ, nāgita, samaye addhānamaggappaṭipanno na kañci passāmi purato vā pacchato vā, phāsu me, nāgita, tasmiṃ samaye hoti antamaso uccārapassāvakammāyā”ti.
an8.86:14.1.eng: Nāgita, when I’m walking along a road and I don’t see anyone ahead or behind I feel relaxed, even if I need to urinate or defecate.”

an8.87:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṃ nikkujjeyya.
an8.87:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upside down for a lay follower on eight grounds.

an8.87:1.3.pli: Bhikkhūnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, bhikkhūnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, bhikkhūnaṃ avāsāya parisakkati, bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati, bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
an8.87:1.3.eng: They try to prevent the mendicants from getting material things. They try to harm mendicants. They try to drive mendicants from a monastery. They insult and abuse mendicants. They divide mendicants against each other. They criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

an8.87:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṃ nikkujjeyya.
an8.87:1.4.eng: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upside down for a lay follower on these eight grounds.

an8.87:2.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṃ ukkujjeyya.
an8.87:2.1.eng: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upright for a lay follower on eight grounds.

an8.87:2.3.pli: Na bhikkhūnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, na bhikkhūnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, na bhikkhūnaṃ avāsāya parisakkati, na bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati, na bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti, buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
an8.87:2.3.eng: They don’t try to prevent the mendicants from getting material things. They don’t try to harm mendicants. They don’t try to drive mendicants from a monastery. They don’t insult and abuse mendicants. They don’t divide mendicants against each other. They don’t criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

an8.87:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pattaṃ ukkujjeyyā”ti.
an8.87:2.4.eng: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upright for a lay follower on these eight grounds.”

an8.88:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā appasādaṃ pavedeyyuṃ.
an8.88:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of no confidence in a mendicant who has eight qualities.

an8.88:1.3.pli: Gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati, gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, agocare ca naṃ passanti.
an8.88:1.3.eng: They try to prevent laypeople from getting material things. They try to harm laypeople. They insult and abuse laypeople. They divide lay people against each other. They criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They’re seen at an inappropriate place for collecting alms.

an8.88:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā appasādaṃ pavedeyyuṃ.
an8.88:1.4.eng: The lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of no confidence in a mendicant who possesses these eight qualities.

an8.88:2.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā pasādaṃ pavedeyyuṃ.
an8.88:2.1.eng: The lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of confidence in a mendicant who has eight qualities.

an8.88:2.3.pli: Na gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, na gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, na gihī akkosati paribhāsati, na gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, gocare ca naṃ passanti.
an8.88:2.3.eng: They don’t try to prevent laypeople from getting material things. They don’t try to harm laypeople. They don’t insult and abuse laypeople. They don’t divide laypeople against each other. They don’t criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They’re not seen at an inappropriate place for collecting alms.

an8.88:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānā upāsakā pasādaṃ pavedeyyun”ti.
an8.88:2.4.eng: The lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of confidence in a mendicant who possesses these eight qualities.”

an8.89:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.
an8.89:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the Saṅgha may, if it wishes, perform an act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.

an8.89:1.3.pli: Gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati, gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammikañca gihipaṭissavaṃ na saccāpeti.
an8.89:1.3.eng: They try to prevent laypeople from getting material things. They try to harm laypeople. They insult and abuse lay people. They divide laypeople against each other. They criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They don’t keep a legitimate promise made to a layperson.

an8.89:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyaṃ kammaṃ kareyya.
an8.89:1.4.eng: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, perform an act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.

an8.89:2.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
an8.89:2.1.eng: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, revoke the act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.

an8.89:2.3.pli: Na gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, na gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, na gihī akkosati paribhāsati, na gihī gihīhi bhedeti, buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammikañca gihipaṭissavaṃ saccāpeti.
an8.89:2.3.eng: They don’t try to prevent the laypeople from getting material things. They don’t try to harm laypeople. They don’t insult and abuse laypeople. They don’t divide laypeople against each other. They don’t criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They keep a legitimate promise made to a layperson.

an8.89:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyyā”ti.
an8.89:2.4.eng: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, revoke the act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.”

an8.9:1.5.pli: Kimaññatra, bhikkhave, nando indriyesu guttadvāro, bhojane mattaññū, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto, satisampajaññena samannāgato, yehi nando sakkoti paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
an8.9:1.5.eng: How could he live the full and pure spiritual life unless he guards the sense doors, eats in moderation, is dedicated to wakefulness, and has mindfulness and situational awareness?

an8.9:1.6.pli: Tatridaṃ, bhikkhave, nandassa indriyesu guttadvāratāya hoti.
an8.9:1.6.eng: This is how Nanda guards the sense doors.

an8.9:1.7.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, nandassa puratthimā disā āloketabbā hoti, sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā nando puratthimaṃ disaṃ āloketi:
an8.9:1.7.eng: If he has to look to the east, he wholeheartedly concentrates before looking, thinking:

an8.9:1.8.pli: ‘evaṃ me puratthimaṃ disaṃ ālokayato nābhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssavissantī’ti.
an8.9:1.8.eng: ‘When I look to the east, bad, unskillful qualities of covetousness and displeasure will not overwhelm me.’

an8.9:1.9.eng: In this way he’s aware of the situation.

an8.9:2.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, nandassa pacchimā disā āloketabbā hoti …pe…
an8.9:2.1.eng: If he has to look to the west …

an8.9:2.6.pli: anudisā anuviloketabbā hoti, sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā nando anudisaṃ anuviloketi:
an8.9:2.6.eng: If he has to survey the intermediate directions, he wholeheartedly concentrates before looking, thinking:

an8.9:2.7.pli: ‘evaṃ me anudisaṃ anuvilokayato nābhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssavissantī’ti.
an8.9:2.7.eng: ‘When I survey the intermediate directions, bad, unskillful qualities of covetousness and displeasure will not overwhelm me.’

an8.9:2.8.eng: In this way he’s aware of the situation.

an8.9:2.9.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, nandassa indriyesu guttadvāratāya hoti.
an8.9:2.9.eng: This is how Nanda guards the sense doors.

an8.9:3.1.pli: Tatridaṃ, bhikkhave, nandassa bhojane mattaññutāya hoti.
an8.9:3.1.eng: This is how Nanda eats in moderation.

an8.9:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, nando paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āhāreti:
an8.9:3.2.eng: Nanda reflects rationally on the food he eats:

an8.9:3.3.pli: ‘neva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya, yāvadeva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya vihiṃsūparatiyā brahmacariyānuggahāya iti purāṇañca vedanaṃ paṭihaṅkhāmi, navañca vedanaṃ na uppādessāmi, yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsuvihāro cā’ti.
an8.9:3.3.eng: ‘Not for fun, indulgence, adornment, or decoration, but only to sustain this body, to avoid harm, and to support spiritual practice. In this way, I shall put an end to old discomfort and not give rise to new discomfort, and I will have the means to keep going, blamelessness, and a comfortable abiding.’

an8.9:3.4.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, nandassa bhojane mattaññutāya hoti.
an8.9:3.4.eng: This is how Nanda eats in moderation.

an8.9:4.1.eng: This is how Nanda is committed to wakefulness.

an8.9:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, nando divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodheti;
an8.9:4.2.eng: Nanda practices walking and sitting meditation by day, purifying his mind from obstacles.

an8.9:4.3.pli: rattiyā paṭhamaṃ yāmaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodheti;
an8.9:4.3.eng: In the first watch of the night, he continues to practice walking and sitting meditation.

an8.9:4.4.pli: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappeti pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā;
an8.9:4.4.eng: In the middle watch, he lies down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.

an8.9:4.5.pli: rattiyā pacchimaṃ yāmaṃ paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodheti.
an8.9:4.5.eng: In the last watch, he gets up and continues to practice walking and sitting meditation, purifying his mind from obstacles.

an8.9:4.6.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, nandassa jāgariyānuyogasmiṃ hoti.
an8.9:4.6.eng: This is how Nanda is committed to wakefulness.

an8.9:5.1.eng: This is how Nanda has mindfulness and situational awareness.

an8.9:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, nandassa viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
an8.9:5.2.eng: Nanda knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an8.9:5.3.eng: He knows perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an8.9:5.4.eng: He knows thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an8.9:5.5.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, nandassa satisampajaññasmiṃ hoti.
an8.9:5.5.eng: This is how Nanda has mindfulness and situational awareness.

an8.9:6.1.pli: Kimaññatra, bhikkhave, nando indriyesu guttadvāro, bhojane mattaññū, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto, satisampajaññena samannāgato, yehi nando sakkoti paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caritun”ti.
an8.9:6.1.eng: How could Nanda live the full and pure spiritual life unless he guards the sense doors, eats in moderation, is dedicated to wakefulness, and has mindfulness and situational awareness?”

an8.90:0.3.eng: Proper Behavior in a Case of Aggravated Misconduct

an8.90:1.1.pli: “Tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabbaṃ—
an8.90:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has been convicted of aggravated misconduct must behave themselves properly in eight respects.

an8.90:1.2.pli: na upasampādetabbo, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na bhikkhunovādakasammuti sāditabbā, sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā, na kāci saṅghasammuti sāditabbā, na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbo, na ca tena mūlena vuṭṭhāpetabbo.
an8.90:1.2.eng: They must not perform an ordination, give dependence, or be attended by a novice. They must not consent to being appointed as adviser for nuns, and if they are appointed they should not give such advice. They must not consent to any Saṅgha appointment. They must not be put in a position of seniority. They must not resolve others from any offense similar to that which they have transgressed.

an8.90:1.3.pli: Tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā imesu aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
an8.90:1.3.eng: A mendicant who has been convicted of aggravated misconduct must behave themselves properly in these eight respects.”

an8.91-117:0.3.eng: Untitled Discourses With Various Laywomen on the Sabbath

an8.91-117:1.1.pli: Atha kho bojjhā upāsikā, sirīmā, padumā, sutanā, manujā, uttarā, muttā, khemā, rucī, cundī, bimbī, sumanā, mallikā, tissā, tissamātā, soṇā, soṇāya mātā, kāṇā, kāṇamātā, uttarā nandamātā, visākhā migāramātā, khujjuttarā upāsikā, sāmāvatī upāsikā, suppavāsā koliyadhītā, suppiyā upāsikā, nakulamātā gahapatānī.
an8.91-117:1.1.eng: And then the lay woman Bojjhā … Sirīmā … Padumā … Sutanā … Manujā … Uttarā … Muttā … Khemā … Somā … Rucī … Cundī … Bimbī … Sumanā … Mallikā … Tissā … Tissamātā … Soṇā … Soṇā’s mother … Kāṇā … Kāṇamātā … Uttarā, Nanda’s mother … Visākhā Migāra’s mother … the lay woman Khujjuttarā … the lay woman Sāmāvatī … Suppavāsā the Koliyan … the lay woman Suppiyā … the housewife Nakula’s mother …
